alert.note: Alert for Chinle Valley; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 07 at 9:46AM MST until January 07 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow above 3500 feet. Additional snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Areas above 3500 feet near Camp Verde, Chinle, Chino Valley, Congress, Cottonwood, Dilkon, Holbrook, Kayenta, Kykotsmovi, Paulden, Prescott, Prescott Valley, Sedona, Seligman, Snowflake-Taylor, Tuba City and Winslow. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Additional snow forecast from 9 AM Today to 5 PM Today: Camp Verde 0 to 1 inches Chinle 1 to 3 inches Chino Valley 1 to 2 inches Congress 0 to 1 inches Cottonwood 0 to 1 inches Dilkon 1 to 3 inches Holbrook 0 to 1 inches Kayenta 1 to 2 inches Kykotsmovi 1 to 3 inches Paulden 0 to 1 inches Prescott 1 to 3 inches Prescott Valley 1 to 2 inches Sedona 2 to 4 inches Seligman 0 to 1 inches Snowflake-Taylr 1 to 2 inches Tuba City 0 to 1 inches Winslow 0 to 1 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
